DOCNAME: CASE OF MÜRVET FİDAN AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Not necessary to examine under Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - financial awards;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . All of the applicants live in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE each of them brought separate actions before ORG against ORG . They alleged that their plots of land were illegally seized by the administration for a dam construction without any payment , and requested compensation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court ruled that the cases should be characterised as compensation claims arising from de facto expropriations rather than claims for illegal seizures . The court established that a committee of experts had assessed the value of the expropriated land in advance and that the authorities had paid the resulting amounts to the owners registered in the local land registry . The court ordered the administration to pay the applicants an amount of increased compensation , plus interest at the statutory rate , starting from DATE when the land was submerged in the waters of the dam .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed these judgments , holding that the cases could not be characterised as compensation claims arising from expropriation . Upon the applicants ' request , however , ORG reversed its decision and held , on DATE , that the cases could in fact be characterised as compensation claims arising from expropriation . It proceeded to quash the judgments of the first - instance court only in respect of the date from which the statutory rate of interest began to run .

CARDINAL . By decisions of CARDINAL DATE and DATE , ORG ordered the administration to pay the applicants a certain amount of compensation , plus interest running from DATE , despite the earlier rulings of ORG regarding the starting date from which interest was to be calculated .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgments of ORG . The same court rejected the applicants ' rectification request on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the administration to pay the applicants CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and MONEY ( ORG ) respectively , plus interest at the statutory rate running from DATE , the date on which the land was transferred to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld these judgments . On DATE ORG rulings were served on the applicants .
CARDINAL . On DATE the administration paid TRL CARDINAL to Ms Mürvet PERSON , CARDINAL GPE to Mr PERSON , GPE CARDINAL Mr PERSON , GPE CARDINAL to PERSON and GPE CARDINAL to PERSON .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice are set out in the ORG v. GPE judgment of DATE ( Reports of Judgments and Decisions CARDINAL ) .
